Author: ryman112#0068
Content: Mandatory wallet upgrade....what does that mean for me having mine on a ledger nano locked away?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: it means that you need to move to a non-proprietary wallet or wait until ledger upgrades

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ledger should update in time

Author: ryman112#0068
Content: Its kind of a pain for me to go get this thing.  So basically before dec. 15th I need to travel back to my home town and get this thing and update it?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
well, you need it to use it to get rewards anyway
if not grabbing rewards, you can update whenever you next use it

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: unless there's a transparent address update that I missed

Author: ryman112#0068
Content: Im out of town working and didn't bring it with me so I suppose Ima make a special trip lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why do you need to update it before you use it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: presumable it all happens server side at ledger HQ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you wont have to do anything special, let alone travel home to get it. if you arent going to do any transactions, why would you need to update anyway? even if you ran a full node, there is no need to update before you need to do transactions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and using a ledger is basically using a lite mode wallet, where the real nodes are maintained by ledger

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so let ledger update, use the ledger next time you use it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why is this a pain? to do nothing

Author: ryman112#0068
Content: Thanks @jl777c

Author: ryman112#0068
Content: It is certainly not a pain now that I understand.  Not that I wouldn't enjoy seeing family.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: except not all the coins traded on barterDEX are tracked by CMC...

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
yes, that
my answer was assuming that the question meant the volume of a given tracked coin
as far as the *entire* bartedex volume, the answer is likely: no, because that would involve tracking every combination of every known usable coin
